info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Capulin, or 15 miles east of Raton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Folsom. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 357 and 359, and between Mile Markers 361 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
